headline: Why analysts think Trump’s 10% credit card fee cap is a low-probability risk
summary: Investing.com -- President Trump’s proposal to cap credit card interest rates at 10% has drawn attention, but analysts say the risk of meaningful disruption to financial stocks is low.

headline: GTCR Completes Sale of Worldpay to Global Payments
summary: GTCR, a leading private equity firm, announced today that it has closed the previously announced sale of Worldpay (the "Company"), a global leader in merchant acquiring and payments processing, to Global Payments (NYSE: GPN) as part of a transformative three-way transaction. The sale of Worldpay represents one of the largest strategic sales in the history of the private equity industry.

headline: Global Payments Completes Acquisition of Worldpay and Divestiture of Issuer Solutions Business, Creating Leading Pure-Play Commerce Solutions Provider
summary: ATLANTA, January 12, 2026--Global Payments Completes Acquisition of Worldpay and Divestiture of Issuer Solutions Business

headline: FIS Completes Strategic Acquisition of Global Payments’ Issuer Solutions Business and Sale of Worldpay Stake
summary: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., January 12, 2026--FIS® (NYSE: FIS), a global leader in financial technology, today announced the completion of its acquisition of Global Payments' Issuer Solutions business, formerly known as TSYS, for an enterprise value of $13.5 billion, or a net purchase price of $12 billion including $1.5 billion of net present value of tax assets. Offerings from this asset, the world’s largest issuing business, will now go to market under the FIS® Total Issuing™ Solutions portfolio brand

headline: Global Payments CEO: Worldpay deal allows us to focus on commerce solutions and payments
summary: Global Payments CEO Cameron Bready joins 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss the company's acquisition of Worldpay, address concerns about the deal, and more.
